page.title: 01General Area Description
page.content: This is a picturesque{rural area}on the uplands situated to the south of Hexham and the Tyne Valley. The {highest point,}at Dotland, (922614) is 236 metres above sea level. From there,one has{extensive views}of rolling countryside, with grassland separated by dry stone walls,grazing sheep and cattle,the yellow of oilseed rape, scattered farmsteads,patches of woodland, both hard and softwood,and narrow,tree-lined streams winding their way towards the Tyne. {Human population}is sparse, the main concentration being in the Juniper-Dye House area,(932608), with a smaller concentration at Whitley Mill. Total population in 1985 is estimated at 250.{Agriculture}is the main industry,divided fairly equally between dairy farming and meat production.
